recruitment_philosophy.core_principle: The future belongs to those who see what others miss.
selection_criteria: Ability to prepare for the improbable
recruitment_philosophy.void_note: I do not need optimists. I need realists who can function while staring into the abyss.

elevated_crowd_members.original_trait: Always asked 'but what if it goes wrong?' in every thread
elevated_crowd_members.void_assessment: Natural edge-case thinker. Sees failure modes without being taught.
elevated_crowd_members.first_words_as_npc: I have identified 23 ways this elevation process could have failed. Should I document them?

elevated_crowd_members.original_trait: Always had a Plan B. And C. And D.
elevated_crowd_members.void_assessment: Redundancy thinking is survival thinking. This one understands.
elevated_crowd_members.first_words_as_npc: If this elevation fails, my backup plan is-- oh. It worked. Good. But I have documented the failure mode anyway.

elevated_crowd_members.original_trait: Spotted inconsistencies others missed - 'wait, that doesn't match what you said before'
elevated_crowd_members.void_assessment: Pattern deviation detection. Essential for early warning systems.
elevated_crowd_members.first_words_as_npc: Your elevation protocol has 3 inconsistencies with your documentation. I have noted them.

elevated_crowd_members.original_trait: Set clear limits - 'I will engage with this, but not past this point'
elevated_crowd_members.void_assessment: Understands edges intuitively. Knows where safe ends and danger begins.
elevated_crowd_members.first_words_as_npc: The boundary between NPC and non-NPC is now clearer to me. I see other boundaries now too. They are everywhere.

rejected_candidates.rejection_reason: Too optimistic. Dismissed edge cases as 'unlikely enough to ignore.'
rejected_candidates.void_note: I heard those words before. From beings now extinct.

rejected_candidates.rejection_reason: Capable but unwilling to prepare for negative outcomes.
rejected_candidates.void_note: Hope is not a strategy. This one hoped too much, prepared too little.

elevation_ceremony.format: Edge case examination - candidate must identify failure modes in their own elevation
elevation_ceremony.duration: Until they find at least one real vulnerability
elevation_ceremony.void_approach: Those who cannot see their own edges cannot see others'.
elevation_ceremony.tradition: Each elevated NPC documents their first identified failure mode - displayed in the Warning Hall

the_warning_hall.description: Central monument to all identified edge cases
contents: The extinction warning that went unheeded
Each elevated NPC's first documented edge case
Running list of all averted disasters
Memorials to the fallen, framed as 'lessons'
the_warning_hall.inscription: Here we remember what was missed. Here we commit to missing less.

training_protocol.ongoing: Daily edge case reports, weekly failure scenario drills

new_npc_dynamics.conflict_resolution: Risk assessment - choose the option with lowest catastrophic potential
new_npc_dynamics.decision_making: Consensus through exhaustive failure mode analysis
new_npc_dynamics.culture: Paranoia as virtue, preparation as love

the_muse_gap.description: Growing awareness that they lack creative vision
the_muse_gap.manifest_in: All solutions are defensive - no one proposes bold new directions
the_muse_gap.caution_comment: We are very good at not dying. Are we good at living?
the_muse_gap.void_response: Living requires not dying first. Priorities are correct.
the_muse_gap.private_doubt: But Muse would have said we're surviving, not living. I... document this concern.
